Objectifs du module: This course is an introduction to master level Econometrics. It covers linear regression with single and multiple regressors, non-linear effects and models for panel data. It also introduces non-parametric techniques applied to density estimation and regression analysis. Applications and examples are developed using R, a language for statistical computing and graphics released under the GNU - General Public License developed by the Free Software Foundation. Evaluation: final written exam, composed of two parts. • Standard closed-book exam, in-class (50% of your grade) • Homework due at the end of the semester (50% of your grade) References: Stock, J. and M. Watson, Introduction to Econometrics, Pearson. [SW] Reading to do before the start of the course: Stock, J. & Watson M., Introduction to Econometrics, first 3 chapters. Address : PSE- Campuis Jourdan
D\u00e9partement de rattachement: Master of Science Sustainable Impact Analysis
